definition: to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
to spread/to lay out/to apply (powder, ointment etc)/sufficient (to cover)/enough
to spread out/to develop/to overflow/to amplify/superfluous
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]

sentences.english: She is very conscientious and never skimps through her work.
sentences.chinese: 她辦事認真，從不敷衍了事。

sentences.english: Britain and Italy should stop temporizing.
sentences.chinese: 英國和意大利應該停止敷衍了事。

sentences.english: They perfunctorily consoled him with a few words.
sentences.chinese: 他們敷衍了事地安慰了他幾句。

sentences.english: The old teacher was muddling on, and nobody could follow what he was trying to say.
sentences.chinese: 這位老教師在敷衍了事，誰也聽不懂他想說什麼。

sentences.english: She is very conscientious and never skimps her work.
sentences.chinese: 她辦事認真，從不敷衍了事。

sentences.english: Patients complain that their doctors hustle them through appointments.
sentences.chinese: 病人抱怨他們的醫生看病敷衍了事。

sentences.english: He always plays fast and loose with his work.
sentences.chinese: 他對工作總是敷衍了事，不正經幹。

sentences.english: Many students in the course of employment because of their dedicated and halfheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 很多學生因爲求職過程的勞心勞力而對其敷衍了事。

sentences.english: Don't scamp your work because you're pressed for time.
sentences.chinese: 不要因爲趕時間而敷衍了事。

sentences.english: There is the pilot program dodge.

sentences.chinese: 他敷衍了事的做完了這事。

sentences.english: There is the long-term care dodge.
sentences.chinese: 長期醫保計劃是敷衍了事。

sentences.english: You’re just going to do the bare minimum to get by.
sentences.chinese: 你只是做了最少的事來敷衍了事。

sentences.english: How can we know we're not just settling?
sentences.chinese: 我們如何知道自己並非敷衍了事？

sentences.english: This is a job that needs to be tackled wholeheartedly-not played at.
sentences.chinese: 這件工作需要全神貫注認真對待，不能敷衍了事。

sentences.english: The tests must not be fudged.
sentences.chinese: 這個測試必須不能敷衍了事。

definition: to rush through the work/to get through a thing carelessly
to skimp on the job/to work half-heartedly/not to take the job seriously
to elaborate (on a theme)/to expound (the classics)/perfunctory/to skimp/to botch/to do sth half-heartedly or just for show/barely enough to get by
to go through the motions
superficial show/going through the motions
careless/sloppy/negligent/skimpy
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
to use all sorts of excuses
to procrastinate
to go through the formalities
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to take a laissez-faire attitude
careless/casual/vague/not so bad/so-so/tolerable/fair
careless/slovenly/illegible (of handwriting)
to decline/to avoid/shirking responsibilities/to blame others/to pass the buck/to unload one's responsibilities/to try to get out of a task
lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick
